availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edley H. Ivey (Grant County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier (11th KY Cav USA))

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Absalom Ivey and Jane Ivey. Resident of Campbell County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farm laborer in Campbell County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to January 25, 1863. Died from disease on January 25, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Campbell County, District 1, p. 231A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Campbell County, District 8, p. 474-5.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0108.
